item.title: Hundreds of trucks full of aid sit idle near border with Gaza as crisis deepens
item.dc:creator: Charlene Gubash and Doha Madani
item.description: RAFAH, Egypt — Hundreds of trucks loaded with food and medical aid sat idle on the roads heading into Gaza recently as a senior humanitarian official accused the Israeli government of blocking lifesaving supplies from reaching the devastated enclave.

media:content.media:text: A line of trucks belonging to the Egyptian Red Crescent.
media:content.media:description: Egyptian Red Crescent trucks loaded with aid queue outside the Rafah border crossing with the Gaza Strip on March 23, 2024.

media:content.media:text: A satellite image from March 21 shows lines of trucks on the road and parked in a lot near the Rafah crossing.
media:content.media:description: A satellite image from March 21 shows lines of trucks on the road and parked in a lot near the Rafah crossing.

item.title: Man receives life-saving transplant after seeing NBC News story
item.description: Dr. Gary Gibbon was battling lung cancer when he saw an NBC News story on experimental transplants being carried out at Northwestern Medicine. A year later, he credits it with saving his life.

media:content.media:title: Man receives life-saving transplant after seeing NBC News story
media:content.media:description: Dr. Gary Gibbon was battling lung cancer when he saw an NBC News story on experimental transplants being carried out at Northwestern Medicine. A year later, he credits it with saving his life.

item.title: Bridge collapse poses the first major challenge for Maryland Gov. Wes Moore, a Democratic rising star
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Marquez and Allan Smith and Mike Memoli
item.description: After a Baltimore bridge collapse killed six people and shut down an international port, Maryland Gov. Wes Moore has stepped into the national spotlight this week, leading the response to the tragic, unforeseen catastrophe.

media:content.media:text: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore
media:content.media:description: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore on March 28, 2024, in Baltimore.

item.title: A family is searching for answers after a pregnant mother was found dead in a Kansas City park
item.dc:creator: Deon J. Hampton
item.description: The family of Elaysha Gilliam, a pregnant mother of four found dead in Kansas City, Missouri, wants to know why the police investigation has stalled.

item.title: Art world descends on Hong Kong as security laws spur censorship fears
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Jett
item.description: A new national security law has deepened fears about self-censorship in the arts in Hong Kong, one of the world’s biggest art markets.

media:content.media:text: Art Basel Hong Kong 2024
media:content.media:description: An installation at the Asia edition of Art Basel in Hong Kong on Thursday.

media:content.media:text: "Pillar Of Shame" Statue Faces Threats Of Removal At HK University
media:content.media:description: A sculpture memorializing the victims of the 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown was removed from the University of Hong Kong campus in 2021.

media:content.media:text: Lawmakers vote for Article 23 in the chamber of the Legislative Council
media:content.media:description: A local national security law was unanimously approved by Hong Kong lawmakers on March 19.

media:content.media:text: Hong Kong Art Basel

item.title: ‘I am so scared of them now’: Burned from overspending, some ‘buy now, pay later’ users warn others away
item.dc:creator: J.J. McCorvey
item.description: After racking up thousands of dollars in debt, some borrowers are deleting the apps from their phones to avoid getting prodded to spend more.

media:content.media:text: Image of a man on computer on top of a stack of boxes
media:content.media:description: Some users of buy now, pay later services have found the extent of their overspending sneaks up on them suddenly.

item.title: Sacre bleu! Camembert and brie 'on the verge of extinction,' French scientists warn
item.dc:creator: Josh Lederman and Briony Sowden
item.description: Camembert and Brie could disappear, scientists in France are warning, owing to a decline of strains of fungus that give them their unique tastes and textures.

media:content.media:credit: Andrew B. Myers for NBC News
media:content.media:text: A wheel of cheese shaped gravestone in a cemetery on a hill, engraved with "Brie."
A Normandy cow that provides milk for Camembert cheese at a farm near Isigny Sainte-Mere; a cheesemaker in Camembert.
media:content.media:description: A Normandy cow that provides milk for Camembert cheese at a farm near Isigny Sainte-Mere; a cheesemaker in Camembert.

media:content.media:text: Camembert cheeses are packed into boxes at the Isigny Sainte
media:content.media:description: Camembert cheeses are packaged at the Isigny Saint-Mere company in Normandy, France.

media:content.media:text: A statue of Marie Harel, born in 1761, invented camembert cheese; cars along the Tour de France route advertise Coeur de Lion camembert cheese in 2002.
media:content.media:description: Marie Harel, born in 1761, invented Camembert cheese; cars along the Tour de France advertise Coeur de Lion Camembert.

item.title: 'Spinning and whirling': Strange fish behavior sparks emergency government response
item.dc:creator: Jason Abbruzzese and Marissa Parra and Maria Piñero and Lora Kolodny, CNBC
item.description: An endangered fish found off the coast of Florida is exhibiting strange behavior, including "spinning and whirling." The government is mounting an emergency response.

media:content.media:text: A smalltooth sawfish
media:content.media:description: This image provided by NOAA shows a smalltooth sawfish. Endangered smalltooth sawfish, marine creatures virtually unchanged for millions of years, are exhibiting erratic spinning behavior and dying in unusual numbers in Florida waters. Federal and state wildlife agencies are beginning an effort to rescue and rehabilitate sawfish to find out why.

media:content.media:text: SeaWorld Orlando senior aquarist Becki Orze points out the male smalltooth sawfish that fathered three baby smalltooth sawfish who were born at SeaWorld Orlando in Orlando, Fla on Oct. 17, 2023.
media:content.media:description: SeaWorld Orlando senior aquarist Becki Orze points out a male smalltooth sawfish that fathered three baby smalltooth sawfish in Orlando, Florida, on Oct. 17, 2023.

item.title: Biden's latest campaign strategy: Get under Trump's skin
item.dc:creator: Mike Memoli and Monica Alba and Jake Traylor
item.description: Biden is turning to personal, biting and often sarcastic attacks against Trump in public and in private, including at a major New York City fundraiser.

media:content.media:text: Image: Joe Biden
media:content.media:description: President Joe Biden at a fundraising event at Radio City Music Hall on Thursday.

item.title: Zelenskyy fires more aides in a reshuffle as Russia launches drones and missiles across Ukraine
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed a longtime aide and several advisers on Saturday in a continuing reshuffle while Russia unleashed fresh attacks overnight.

item.title: Three U.N. observers and a translator wounded in south Lebanon, peacekeeping mission says
item.dc:creator: Reuters and Aurora Almendral
item.description: An strike on Saturday hit a vehicle carrying United Nations technical observers outside the southern Lebanese border town of Rmeish, wounding several observers, two security sources told Reuters, who attriubted the strike to Israel.

item.title: Police detain man who walked out of nightclub where hostages were being held in Dutch town
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Heavily armed police cordoned off part of a Dutch town on Saturday, saying that multiple people were being held hostage, and have evacuated nearby homes.

media:content.media:text: Heavily armed police have cordoned off part of a Dutch town and say that multiple people are being held hostage in a building there.
media:content.media:description: Heavily armed police have cordoned off part of a Dutch town and say that multiple people are being held hostage in a building there.

item.title: A doctor with lung cancer got a lifesaving treatment after seeing an NBC News report
item.dc:creator: Kaitlin Sullivan and Kate Snow and Jessica Herzberg
item.description: After NBC News reported on a new transplant technique for lung cancer, a California man with advanced cancer reached out to Northwestern Medicine and received a double lung and liver transplant.

media:content.media:text: Six months after surgery Dr. Gary Gibbon is cancer free.
media:content.media:description: Six months after surgery Dr. Gary Gibbon is cancer free.

media:content.media:text: Dr. Gary Gibbon recovering from the double lung and liver transplant.
media:content.media:description: Dr. Gary Gibbon recovering from the double lung and liver transplant.

item.title: The U.S. welcomes the new Palestinian government following its repeated calls for political reform
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: The United States has welcomed the formation of a new Palestinian autonomy government, signaling it is accepting the revised Cabinet lineup as a step toward Palestinian political reform.

media:content.media:text: Image: Mahmoud Abbas
media:content.media:description: In a file photo, Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas speaks during a conference to support Jerusalem at the Arab League headquarters in Cairo, Egypt, in 2023.

item.title: Radio Free Asia closes Hong Kong bureau, citing security law concerns
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Jett and Abigail Williams
item.description: Radio Free Asia is withdrawing from Hong Kong, the U.S.-funded media outlet said, citing rising concerns about press freedom in the Chinese territory.

media:content.media:text: Hong Kong China Handover
media:content.media:description: A man waving the Chinese flag in Hong Kong on July 1, 2022, to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the former British colony’s return to Chinese rule.

media:content.media:text: Hong Kong Protests Against China's Proposed Security Law
media:content.media:description: Pro-democracy supporters scuffling with riot police in Hong Kong in 2020.

item.title: Trump shares video with image depicting Biden tied up in the back of a pickup truck
item.dc:creator: Megan Lebowitz
item.description: Former President Donald Trump shared a video on social media Friday that included an image of President Joe Biden bound and restrained in the back of a pickup truck.

media:content.media:text: Image: Donald Trump
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump in Harrisburg, Pa., on Feb. 9.

item.title: 7 hurt after Newark-bound United flight experiences turbulence
item.dc:creator: Phil Helsel and TJ Swigart and Jay Blackman
item.description: Seven people were hurt, none seriously, after a United Airlines plane headed to a New York City-area airport experienced high winds and turbulence, officials said.

media:content.media:text: airplane incident
media:content.media:description: A United Plane after landing due to turbulence at New York Stewart International Airport in Orange County, N.Y., on March 29, 2024.
